definition: abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]

sentences.english: The book was out of print, but I eventually ran it to earth at a secondhand bookshop.
sentences.chinese: 那本書已經絕版，但我終於在一家舊書店淘到了它。

sentences.english: I got this book by chance at a second-hand bookshop.
sentences.chinese: 趕巧在一家舊書店裏買到這本書。

sentences.english: Diarmuid: Second-hand and antiquarian books, and sheet music; they have something for everyone.
sentences.chinese: 他們還有舊書和古物古玩類的書刊和各種樂譜。

sentences.english: That old book is my most precious possession.
sentences.chinese: 那本舊書是我最珍貴的財產。

sentences.english: I picked up that dictionary in a second-hand book shop.
sentences.chinese: 這本字典是我偶然在一家舊書店裏找到的。

sentences.english: Think about the benefit of old books on the shop, taste all dark alex also stay airflow.
sentences.chinese: 想想網店上那實惠的舊書，嚐盡甜頭也留得半世風流。

sentences.english: The old book is gradually disintegrating with age.
sentences.chinese: 這本舊書因長年翻閱正在逐漸破損。

sentences.english: This new edition of this old book is an excellent one.
sentences.chinese: 這本舊書的新版做得非常好。

sentences.english: They browsed about the second-hand bookshops.
The Lello bookstore in Porto, Portugal.
sentences.chinese: 新藝術風格舊書店，葡萄牙。

sentences.english: I got this book by chance at a second-hand bookshop.
sentences.chinese: 我趕巧在一家舊書店裏買到這本書。

sentences.english: And Martin has the curiosity of a child, constantly wondering aloud whether he can create new, interesting sculptures, such as an entire, usable bedroom set he made out of old books.
sentences.chinese: 比如他用舊書造了一個可用的整體式臥室。

sentences.english: I gave him a second-hand book, which was my gift to him.
sentences.chinese: 我給了他一本舊書，這就是我給他的禮物。

sentences.english: He poked about in a second-hand bookstore.
I've been ferreting around among my old papers and books for the missing letter.
sentences.chinese: 我一直在我的舊文件和舊書堆裏搜尋那封失蹤的信。

sentences.english: They are connected with cherished associations which the new ones can never have. And for this irrecoverable loss，I am to blame.
sentences.chinese: 舊書與往事相連，這種不可彌補的損失，皆由我起。

definition: to thumb through/to flip through (a book)
old property (esp. inherited from former generation)/former territory
to sell/to betray/to spare no effort/to show off or flaunt
